content: Hi, I noticed this comment in the source that refers to an unimplemented "module system". I was wondering: is this just a line of comment that should have been deleted since Lean already has modules, or are (were?) there plans for a more sophisticated "module system" in Lean ?
The plan still exists and is probably going to be set in motion this year but there is nothing too concrete so far
I think the module system has also been mentioned recently in the lean together talk by Lean FRO
What is not clear to me yet is what modules will mean, in addition to what already exists
Further isolation between different files through e.g. clamping down on defeq across files in order to provide more stability and potentially faster re compilation for example
Oh, well, glad to hear that's in Lean FRO's plans! I guess this solves this topic, thanks for your answers :)
Julien Marquet-Wagner has marked this topic as resolved.
